title: Does God exist physically? If not, how can he interact with the physical universe? - Quora

response.answer_text: Does God exist physically? A~~~~~~~~~~~This question would be better phrased as "According to the particular god-centric rumors you believe--Does God exist physically?”After all, it's not like we can turn to collected facts about an actual existing God to appeal to to get the correct or accurate answers to such questions. All we have to turn to are a gazillion unconfirmed rumors about God and gods. What they supposedly did in the past, how they supposedly behave and supposedly think, how they supposedly feel about certain topics, etc. And since many of those collected rumors contradict each other, the only answer you can get that addresses your question directly is someone else's PREFERRED rumor. Maybe the ones they were raised with~~or even ones that differ vastly from their peers. Perhaps even a combination of two or more unconfirmed rumors mashed together to create an all-new unconfirmed rumor about God or gods. It’s an all-too-common occurrence that, every day, someone is making up new rumors about what God did this week. How he supposedly created and sent that hurricane for some purpose, etc. Or some other event in which “God” is supposedly pulling the magical strings. These kinds of questions are fine if you're interested in the variety of superstitious beliefs out there in the real world~~that can actually be fairly interesting. But if you seek FACTS about actual existing God or gods, you won't find any. Because we don't have any.

This question makes no sense; at least the second part doesn’t. If I answer that god does not exist physically, I may also argue that god does not exist at all, which I in fact do so argue. Therefore, he CAN’T interact with the physical universe. I presume you mean to assume that god exists, but in some non-physical sense. If that were so, the answer to how he could influence the physical universe would be “using the same imaginary magic that he does at all other times.”

“Does God exist physically? If not, how can he interact with the physical universe?” God isn’t physical, and there is no “physical universe”. As Śhankara says, “God alone is real, this physical world is an illusion”. In the west, Bishop Berkeley, the famous philosopher after whom they named the well-known University in the San Francisco Bay area, also pointed this out.

In a warehouse full of wooden benches, one.of the bench was.heard saying,”Does wood exist otherwise how it wants to interact with all the benches here!” Similarly, one.of the alphabets is asking,”Does ink exist otherwise how it wants to interact with all the alphabets here.”

God is a story we were told when we were little children and had no defenses against believing all the fairy tales told to us by adults. We outgrow most of those stories but the God story persists in most peoples’ minds because it appeals to multiple wishes: that we live forever, somehow; that there is an ultimate authority figure who makes all the rules; that there is ultimate justice to address our sense of fairness. It’s just a story, which is why you asked because if God was physical, it would have been noticed by now.

This is a good question, and has yet to be properly answered. “He just does” and “magic hand waving” are not actually answers of course. And by definition, anything that interacts with the physical world is physical, and anything that is physical interacts with the physical world. It’s the only test of whether something exists.

Does God exist physically? If not, how can he interact with the physical universe? +JMJ+ Yes, God physically exists. He incarnated as a man back in the first century, and will remain a man for all of sempiternity.
The rules of this universe does not apply to that which is beyond this universe. Otherwise, your god is flawed instead of being perfect
no. God doesn’t have a human like body made of what we call physical. he is energy. pure energy. and energy is in everything from the biggest planet to the smallest atom.
OMG, God is not about physical universe
